intro: Anemonastrum elongatum, commonly known as the long-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features spiny, cylindrical stems and narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. Anemonastrum elongatum is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep roots that help it endure drought conditions.
